eng: we welcome in particular those who have travelled from abroad to be here, helene pastoors, michael dingake from botswana, mr andimba toivo ya toivo of swapo in namibia.
sot: ntata rona, mopresidente wa mehleng kenneth kaunda wa zambia.

eng: we also recognise the role of the leader of the inkatha freedom party, inkosi mangosuthu buthelezi, who also called for madiba’s release, as well as that of other political prisoners and the return of exiles.
sot: re amohela ka ho ikgetha ba tswang mose hore ba be le rona mona, helene pastoors, michael dingake wa botswana, monghadi andimba toivo ya toivo wa swapo ya namibia.

eng: let us pursue the ideal for which madiba has fought his entire life – the ideal of a democratic and free society, in which all persons live together in harmony and with equal opportunities.
sot: baheso ba hlomphehileng,aforika borwa e sa ntse e tla ananela ka botlalo, karolo ya bohlokwa e bapetsweng ke moporesidente wa mehleng wa anc, wa mphato oliver tambo, ya entseng motheo wa hore naha ena e be mohlala o motle wa tokoloho le demokerasi.

eng: honourable members,we called a joint sitting in the evening so that the majority in our country, workers and schoolchildren, can be part of the occasion.
sot: ke boetapele ba hae bo hlwahlwa, tjhebelopele le pono e hlakileng tse entseng hore anc e matlafatse tsela ya ditumellano tsa ditherisano.

eng: our industrial policy action plan and our new focus on green jobs, will build stronger and more labour-absorbing industries.
sot: re kentshe tshebetsong mekgwa e matla kgahlanong le maemo a mabe a moruo jwaloka mmuso ka ho kgina metheo ya setjhaba.

eng: our rural development programme will improve rural productivity, and the lives of people living in rural areas.
sot: bakeng sa ho bebofatsa mathata a bafutsanehileng, re potlakisitse ho nyollwa ha ditjhelete tsa letlole la thuso la tshehetso ya bana, mme ra eketsa dilemo tsa bana ba lokelang ho fumana tshehetso ya tjhelete ya thuso ka ho kenyeletsa le bana ba dilemo tse ka hodimo ho tse 14. dilemong tse tharo tse tlang, bana ba tlatsetso ba dimilione tse pedi ba tswang malapeng le matlong a futsanehileng, ba dilemo tse 15 ho ya ho 18, ba tla una molemo letloleng la thuso ya tshehetso ya bana.

eng: we are building a performance-oriented state, by improving planning as well as performance monitoring and evaluation.
sot: lenaneo la rona la ntshetsopele ya dibaka tsa mahae le tla ntlafatsa tlhahiso ya mahaeng, le maphelo a baahi ba metseng ya mahae.

eng: we also need to integrate gender equity measures into the government’s programme of action.
sot: seo e leng sa bohlokwa mawaleng a rona a ho hodisa le ho tsoseletsa moruo, ke lenaneo la rona la ho tsetela meahong.

eng: this includes building and upgrading hospitals and clinics, and further improving the working conditions of healthcare workers.
sot: ho tlatseletsa, re tla sebetsa ka matla ho ntlafatsa tshebetso e tswileng matsoho ya mmuso wa lehae, ntshetsopele ya metheo ya setjhaba le bodulo ba batho.

eng: we have identified the fight against hijacking, business and house robberies, as well as contact crimes such as murder, rape and assault, as top priorities.
sot: re amohela peho ya kgwedi e fetileng e entsweng ke mekgatlo e meraro ya matitjhere, naptosa, sadtu and saou, ka ho thatiselletsa boitlamo ba bona bakeng sa letsholo la boleng ba ho ithuta le ho ruta ho tloha qalong ya 2010. ditho tse hlomphehileng,re lokela ho tsetela batjheng ba rona ho netefatsa hore re na le lebotho le rupelletsweng le basebetsi ba nang le bokgoni bakeng sa ho tshehetsa kgolo le tlhahiso ya mesebetsi.

eng: municipalities must improve the provision of housing, water, sanitation, electricity, waste management and roads.
sot: sena se kenyelatsa kaho le ntlafatso ya dipetlele le ditliliniki, le ho ntlafatsa maemo a tshebetso a basebeletsi ba tsa bophelo.

eng: we held a meeting with mayors and municipal managers last year.
sot: re imatahantse le banka ya ntshetsopele ya aforika e borwa ho ntlafatsa tshebetso ya dipetlele tsa setjhaba le diofisi tsa tsona tsa ditereke.

eng: we also visited various communities and municipalities, including balfour in mpumalanga and thembisa in gauteng.
sot: re bile re sebetsa mmoho le banka ya ntshetsopele ya aforika e borwa le koporasi ya ntshetsopele ya diindaseteri, lenaneong la mmuso la ho matahanya tshebedisano mahareng a mekgatlo ya poraefete le ya mmuso bakeng sa ho ntlafatsa dipetlele le phano ya ditjhelete bakeng sa diporojeke.

eng: south africa continues to play a leading role in continental efforts to strengthen the african union and its organs, and to work for unity.
sot: tswelopele e se e entswe bakeng sa ho fana ka motheo wa setjhaba ho tshehetsa ntshetsopele ya temo, le kwetliso bakeng sa baahi.

eng: honourable members,we continue our efforts to eradicate corruption and fraud in procurement and tender processes, and in applications for drivers’ licences, social grants and identity documents, among others.
sot: setjhaba sa maaforika borwa se ka labella phokotso e nngwe e phatlaletseng ya sekgahla sa ditjeho tsa, diselefouno, mehala ya ka malapeng le ya setjhaba.

eng: fellow south africans,as we celebrate madiba’s release today, we recommit ourselves to reconciliation, national unity, non-racialism and building a better future together as south africans, black and white.
sot: ke lakatsa ho ananela ka ho ikgetha moaforika borwa a sa keng a hloleha ho thusa nakong tsa dikoduwa, le ho re thusa ho ntshetsapele pono ya setjhaba se kgathallang.

eng: honourable speaker of the national assembly,chairperson of the national council of provinces.
sot: 13 feb 2014motsamaisi wa dipuisano ya hlomphehang wa seboka sa naha,modulasetulo wa lekgotla la naha la diporofense (ncop).

eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop.
sot: motlatsi wa motsamaisi wa dipuisano wa seboka sa naha le motlatsi wa modulasetulo wa ncop.

eng: deputy president of the republic, honourable kgalema motlanthe.
sot: motlatsi wa moporesidente wa rephaboliki, mohlomphehi kgalema motlanthe.

eng: former deputy president baleka mbethe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary.
sot: motlatsi wa mehleng wa moporesidente mme baleka mbethe,moahlodi e moholo ya hlomphehang wa rephaboliki, le ditho tsohle tse kgabane tsa boahlodi.

eng: honourable ministers and deputy ministers,distinguished premiers and speakers of our provinces.
sot: bahlomphehi matona le batlatsi ba matona,ditonakgolo le batsamaisi ba dipuisano ba diporofense tsa rona ka ho qolleha.

eng: chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership.
sot: modulasetulo wa lekgotla la mmuso wa dibaka la aforika borwa (salga), le boetapele bohle ba mmuso wa dibaka.

eng: chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders.
sot: modulasetulo wa ntlo ya naha ya baetapele ba setso.

eng: heads of chapter 9 institutions.
sot: dihlooho tsa ditheo tsa kgaolo ya 9 tsa puso tse tshehetsang molaotheo wa demokerasi.

eng: the governor of the reserve bank,leaders from business, sports, traditional, religious and all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps, special and distinguished guests,honourable members,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.
sot: mmusisi wa banka ya risefe,baetapele ba tsa kgwebo, dipapadi, setso, bodumedi le makala ohle,ditho tsa boqosa, baeti ba kgethehileng le ba qollehileng,ditho tse hlomphehang,maaforika borwa a heso,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.

eng: i wish to thank the presiding officers for this opportunity to speak to the people of south africa, on this occasion of the last state of the nation address, of the fourth democratic administration.
sot: ke batla ho leboha bahlanka ba baholo ka monyetla ona wa hore ke bue le batho ba aforika borwa, moketjaneng ona wa puo ya ho qetela ya boemo ba naha, ya botsamaisi ba bone ba demokrasi.

eng: i would like to extend our deepest condolences on the passing of the late honourable mr ben skhosana, one of the longest serving and most senior members of this august house and our former minister of correctional services.
sot: ke batla ho fetisa matshediso ka ho hlokahala ha mohlomphehi ntate ben skhosana, e mong wa ditho tse sebeditseng ka nako e telele ebile e le e mong wa batho ba baholo ka ntlong ena e hlomphehang athe e ne e le letona la mehleng la ditshebeletso tsa tshokollo ya batshwaruwa.

eng: we are truly saddened by his sudden passing.
sot: re utlwile bohloko haholo ka ho hlokahala ha hae ka tshohanyetso.

eng: sidlulisa ukukhala kwethu emndenini wakhe, nakumholi we ifp ushenge, kanye namalunga onke e-ifp.
sot: re fetisetsa matshediso a rona lelapeng la hae, le ho shenge, moetapele wa ifp le ho ditho tsohle tsa ifp.

eng: (we wish to extend our heartfelt condolences to his family and also to the ifp leader, shenge, as well as all the members of the ifp.
sot: motsamaisi wa dipuisano ya hlomphehang,modulasetulo ya hlomphehang wa ncop,ena ke puo ya pele ya boemo ba naha ho etsahala moporesidente wa pele, mobabatsehi nelson rholihlahla mandela a le siyo.

eng: )honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,this is the first state of the nation address to take place in the absence of our founding president, his excellency nelson rolihlahla mandela.
sot: ho hlokahala ha hae, selemong se etellang pele selemo sa bo20 sa tokoloho ya rona le demokrasi, ho hlabile batho babo rona habohloko esita le ka nqane ho meedi ya rona.

eng: we find solace in the knowledge that madiba will live forever be in our hearts, and that we have a duty to take his legacy forward.
sot: re tshediswa ke ho tseba hore madiba o tla phela ka ho sa feleng dipelong tsa rona, le hore re na le boikarabelo ba ho ntshetsapele mosebetsi wa hae.

eng: honourable members,our country has produced men and women of distinction, who have provided leadership during trying times.
sot: ditho tse hlomphehang,naha ya rona e hlahisitse banna le basadi ba qollehileng, ba faneng ka boetapele dinakong tsa mathata.

eng: one such leader was mr moses kotane, former treasurer-general of the anc and former sacp general secretary.
sot: moetapele e mong ya jwalo e ne e le ntate moses kotane, motshwari wa mehleng wa matlotlo ka kakaretso wa anc ebile e le mongodikakaretso wa mehleng wa sacp.

eng: we are honouredto have his dear wife, mama rebecca kotane, as our special guest this evening.
sot: re tlotlehile ka boteng ba mofumahadi wa hae, mme rebecca kotane, e le moeti wa rona wa bohlokwa phirimaneng ena.

eng: mama kotane turned 102 years old yesterday, and we wish her all the best.
sot: mme kotane o qetile dilemo tse 102 maobane, mme re mo lakaletsa mahlohonolo.

eng: we also pay tribute to the former anc president mr oliver tambo, who kept the torch of freedom alive both at home and abroad during the most difficult times of our struggle.
sot: re boela re hlompha moporesidente wa mehleng wa anc ntate oliver tambo, ya ileng a boloka lebone la tokoloho le ntse le tuka kwano lapeng esita le kantle dinakong tsa mathata a ntwa ya tokoloho.

eng: his son, dali and his wife rachel are sharing this occasion with us this evening.
sot: mora wa hae, dali le mofumahadi wa hae rachel ba na le rona moketjaneng ona phirimaneng ena.

eng: we salute solomon mahlangu, a brave young man who went defiantly to the gallows in 1979 where he was executed at the age of 23. he said: “my blood will nourish the tree that will bear the fruits of freedom.
sot: re hlompha solomon mahlangu, mohlankana ya sebete ya ileng a ya thapong a rakalletse ka 1979 moo a ileng a fanyehwa teng a le dilemo di 23. o ne a re: “madi a ka a tla nontsha sefate se tla bea ditholwana tsa tokoloho.

eng: tell my people that i love them.
sot: bolellang batho beso hore ke a ba rata.

eng: they must continue the fight’’.
sot: ba tlameha ho hahamalla pele ka ntwa”.

eng: we are honoured to host his mother, mama martha mahlangu and her grand-daughter bathabile.
sot: re tlotlehile ka boteng ba mme wa hae, mme martha mahlangu le setloholo sa hae bathabile.

eng: the year 2014 also marks the 40th anniversary of the cowardly murder through a parcel bomb, of student leader, abram onkgopotse tiro in 1974 in botswana.
sot: selemo sa 2014 se boela e ba sehopotso sa bo40 sa ho fenethwa ka bokwala ha moetapele wa baithuti, abram onkgopotse tiro, ka phasele e neng e na le seqhomane ka 1974 botswana.

eng: we welcome his brother, mogomotsi tiro to this occasion.
sot: re amohela moena wa hae, mogomotsi tiro moketjaneng ona.

eng: we remember those who died in state-sponsored violence of the 1980s and 1990s in our townships and villages.
sot: re hopola bao ba hlokahalletseng merusung e neng e tsheheditswe ke mmuso dilemong tsa bo1980 le 1990 makeisheneng le metsaneng ya habo rona.

eng: ms jabu ndlovu, a former shopsteward of the national union of metalworkers of south africa (numsa), was gunned down in 1988 in pietermaritzburg together with her husband jabulani and their son.
sot: mme jabu ndlovu, moemedi wa basebetsi wa mokgatlo wa naha wa basebetsi ba tshepe wa aforika borwa (numsa), o ile a thunngwa ka 1988 pietermaritzburg mmoho le monna wa hae le mora wa bona.

eng: we welcome her daughter luhle and son, sanele, and pay tribute to all families who lost their loved ones, across the political spectrum.
sot: re amohela moradi wa hae luhle le mora, sanele, mme re hlompha malapa ohle a shwetseng ke beng ka bona, lepatlelong la dipolotiki ka kakaretso.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,we were able to overcome all that pain of the past and build a new society.
sot: motsamaisi wa dipuisano ya hlomphehang,modulasetulo ya hlomphehang wa ncop,re ile ra kgona ho le hlola lehlaba leo la nako e fetileng mme ra aha setjhaba se setjha.

eng: we have built strong institutions of democracy.
sot: re ahile ditheo tse matla tsa demokrasi.

eng: we buried the undemocratic, unrepresentative, oppressive and corrupt state that was serving a minority.
sot: re bitletse mmuso o se nang demokrasi, o se nang boemedi, wa kgatello o bile o le bonyofonyofo o neng o sebeletsa ba mmalwa.

eng: we formed a unitary, non-racial, non-sexist democratic state, answerable to and representative of all south africans.
sot: re bopile mmuso wa demokrasi o kopaneng, o se nang kgethollo ya morabe o arabelang o bile o emetse maaforika borwa ohle.

eng: we created a thriving constitutional democracy, with well-functioning arms of the state –the legislature, the executive and the judiciary.
sot: re theile demokrasi ya molaotheo e hlamaselang, ka makala a mmuso a sebetsang hantle – ketsamelao, phethahatso le boahlodi.

eng: we have chapter 9 institutions which support democracy and protect the rights of citizens.¬liberation and democracy have also created space for an active civil society and a free media.
sot: re na le ditheo tsa kgaolo ya 9 tse tshehetsang demokrasi di bile di tshireletsa ditokelo tsa baahi.

eng: liberation also brought for the first time, the promise of gender equality.
sot: tokoloho le demokrasi le tsona di theile lepatlelo la setjhaba se sebetsang le mediya e lokolohileng.

eng: the representation of women in public institutions has increased considerably since the dawn of freedom, and the extension of basic services also benefits women.
sot: boemedi ba basadi bo eketsehile haholo ditheong tsa mmuso haesale ho tloha ka mafube a tokoloho, athe katoloso ya ditshebeletso tsa mantlha le yona e thusa basadi.

eng: all these attributes have made south africa a much better place to live in now than it has ever been.
sot: makgetha ana ohle a entse aforika borwa hore e be sebaka se betere ho phela ho sona jwale ho feta neng kapa neng.

eng: however, our country still faces the triple challenge of poverty, inequality and unemployment, which we continue to grapple with.
sot: leha ho le jwalo, naha ya rona e ntse e tobane le diphephetso tse tharo tsa bofuma, ho se lekane le leqeme la mesebetsi, tseo re tswelang pele ho lwantshana le tsona.

eng: dealing with these challenges has become a central focus of all democratic administrations.
sot: ho sebetsana le diphephetso tsena e bile setsiketsi sa tsepamiso ya maikutlo ya botsamaisi bohle ba demokrasi.

eng: we elected to focus on five priorities, education, health, the fight against crime and corruption, rural development and land reform as well as creating decent work.
sot: re kgethile ho tsepamisa maikutlo dinthong tse hlano tse ka sehloohong e leng thuto, bophelo bo botle, twantsho ya ditlolo tsa molao le bonyofonyofo, ntshetsopele ya dibaka tsa mahaeng le tlhabollo ya naha esita le ho thea mesebetsi e metle.

eng: we also reorganised the state to improve performance.
sot: re boetse re hlophisitse botjha mmuso ho ntlafatsa tshebetso.

eng: we created two key functions, long term planning as well as monitoring and evaluation.
sot: re theile ditshebetso tse pedi tsa bohlokwa, thero ya nako e telele esita le bodisa le tlhahlobo.

eng: we established the national planning commission which produced the landmark national development plan, the country’s socio-economic blueprint and one of the major achievements of this fourth administration.
sot: re theile khomishene ya merero ya naha e tswetseng morero wa ntshetsopele ya naha (ndp), e leng merero ya naha ka botebo ebile e le enngwe ya dikatleho tse ka sehloohong tsa botsamaisi bona ba bone.

eng: the plan outlines what we should do to eradicate poverty, increase employment and reduce inequality by 2030. our monitoring and evaluation indicates that many services continue to improve.
sot: morero o rala seo re tshwanelang ho se etsa ho fedisa bofuma, ho eketsa mesebetsi le ho fokotsa ho se lekane ka 2030. bodisa ba rona le tlhahlobo di bontsha hore ditshebeletso tse ngata di ntse di tswala pele ho ntlafala.

eng: for example, social grants and identity documents now take a shorter time to be processed.
sot: ho tea mohlala, dithekolohelo tsa ditjhelete setjhabeng le ditokomane tsa boitsebiso jwale di se di nka nako e kgutshwane ho phethelwa.

eng: but many others still require further work.
sot: empa tse ding tse ngata di ntse di hloka ho ntlafatswa.

eng: i will report back on the five priorities, starting with the economy.
sot: ke tla tlaleha ka tse hlano tse ka sehloohong, ke qala ka moruo.

eng: on average, the economy has grown at 3,2 percent a year from 1994 to 2012 despite the global recession which claimed a million jobs.
sot: ka kakaretso, moruo o hotse ka 3,2% ka selemo ho tloha ka 1994 ho ya ho 2012 ntle le putlamo ya moruo lefatsheng e fedisitseng mesebetsi e milione.

eng: working together as government, business, labour and the community sector, we nursed the economy to a recovery.
sot: ho sebetseng mmoho re le mmuso le lekala la kgwebo, mesebetsi le setjhaba, re kakasitse moruo ho o tsosolosa.

eng: the national wealth, measured in terms of gdp, has grown to more than 3.5 trillion rand.
sot: maruo a naha, a lekanngwang ka tsela ya ntshetsopele ya kgolo (gdp), a hotse ho ya feta r3,5 trilione.

eng: jobs are now being created again.
sot: jwale mesebetsi e thewa hape.

eng: there are now 15 million people with jobs in the country, the highest ever in our history, and over 650 thousand jobs were created last year, according to stats sa.
sot: ho na le batho ba dimilione tse 15 jwale ba sebetsang naheng, lenane le hodimo ka ho fetisisa nalaneng ya rona, athe mesebetsi e fetang 650 000 e ile ya thewa ngwahola, ho ya ka ba tsa lefapha la dipalopalo la aforika borwa.

eng: this is still not good enough.
sot: hona ho ntse ho sa lekana.

eng: the unemployment rate still remains high.
sot: leqeme la mesebetsi le ntse le le hodimo.

eng: youth unemployment in south africa continues to be of concern, as it is throughout the world.
sot: leqeme la mesebetsi batjheng ba aforika borwa le ntse le tswela pele ho ngongorehisa, jwaloka ha ho le jwalo lefatshe lohle.

eng: we are taking a number of measures, including the employment tax incentive act which encourages employers to hire younger workers.
sot: re nka dikgato tse ngatanyana, ho akga le molao wa ditsiane tsa lekgetho la mesebetsi o kgothaletsang bahiri ho hira basebetsi bao e leng batjha.

eng: regulations will be passed to ensure that this does not affect unsubsidized or older workers adversely.
sot: ho tla etswa melawana ho netefatsa hore sena ha se ame basebetsi ba sa tshehetswang ka ditjhelete kapa ba seng ba hodile, hampe.

eng: further measures are contained in the national youth accord that was signed in soweto last april.
sot: dikgato tse ding di fuperwe ke selekane sa naha sa batjha se tekennweng soweto ngwahola ka mmesa.

eng: the expanded public works programme and the community work programme continue to be an effective cushion for the poor and the youth.
sot: lenaneo la katoloso ya mesebetsi ya setjhaba le lenaneo la mesebetsi ya dibaka a tswela pele ho ba seikokotlelo sa bafutsana le batjha.

eng: we have created 3,7 million work opportunities over the past five years.
sot: re theile menyetla e 3,7 milione ya mesebetsi dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng.

eng: our people obtain an income and skills from the public works programme, which they use to seek formal employment.
sot: batho ba habo rona ba fumana tjheletenyana le tsebo lenaneong la mesebetsi ya setjhaba, tseo ba di sebedisang ho batla mesebetsi e tsitsitseng.

eng: cabinet has set a target of 6 million work opportunities from this year to 2019, targeting the youth.
sot: kabinete e entse pehelo ya menyetla ya mosebetsi e dimilione tse 6 ho tloha monongwaha ho ya ho 2019, e tsepamisitse maikutlo batjheng.

eng: our social assistance programme which now reaches about 16 million people, provides a safety for millions, especially vulnerable children.
sot: lenaneo la rona la thuso ya setjhaba, leo hajwale le fihlellang bathong ba ka bang dimilione tse 16, le fana ka polokeho ho dimilione tsa batho, haholoholo bana ba kotsing.

eng: (many households are benefiting from government grants which are child support grants, pension as well as disability grants.
sot: malapa a mangata a thuseha ka lebaka la dithekolohelo tsa mmuso, tjhelete ya bana, penshene ya metsofe le ba holofetseng.

eng: (government will continue paying out these grants because many households highly depend on them since job opportunities are scarce during these trying times of an economic downturn.
sot: dithekolohelo tsena di tla nne di tswele pele hobane malapa a mangata a fumana thuso kaha menyetla ya mesebetsi e fokola ka nakong ena eo moruo o putlameng.

eng: (these opportunities, which are made available by government, are enabling us to proudly say that we are currently living in a country that is far better compared to the one we lived in before 1994.
sot: menyetla ena e fumanehang mmusong e etsa hore re bue ka ho ikgantsha re re, aforika borwa eo re phelang ho yona e betere haholo ho e na le eo re neng re phela ho yona pele ho 1994. baheso,re ntse re le nakong e boima.

eng: developments in the united states economy have led to a rapid depreciation in the emerging market currencies, including the rand.
sot: diketsahalo tsa moruo wa amerika di lebisitse ho nyotobeleng ka potlako ha ditjhelete tsa mebaraka e ntseng e thuthua.

eng: during the course of 2013, the rand depreciated by 17.6 per cent against the us dollar.
sot: nakong ya 2013, ranta e nyotobetse ka 17.6% kgahlanong le dolara ya amerika.

eng: the weaker exchange rate poses a significant risk to inflation and will also make our infrastructure programme more expensive.
sot: sekgahla se fokolang sa kananyetsano se momme kotsi e kgolo ho infleishene mme se tla boela se etsa hore lenaneo la rona la meralo ya motheo le je tjhelete e ngata le ho feta.

eng: however, export companies, particularly in the manufacturing sector, should take advantage of the weaker rand and the stronger global recovery.
sot: leha ho le jwalo, dikhamphane tsa diyantle, haholoholo lekaleng la tlhahiso, di tshwanela ho nka monyetla wa ranta e fokolang le ho iphumana ho matla moruong wa lefatshe.

eng: while we have these difficulties, we know that we can cope with this period of turbulence.
sot: leha re ntse re na le mathata ana, re a tseba hore re ka rakalla nakong ya qhaqhangqhang ena.

eng: we have done so before in the past five years.
sot: re entse jwalo dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng.

eng: we will, in fact, emerge stronger if we do the right things.
sot: hantlentle, re tla bitoha re le matla le ho feta haeba re etsa dintho tse nepahetseng.

eng: we have to work together as government, business and labour to grow our economy at rates that are above 5 per cent to be able to create the jobs we need.
sot: re tshwanela ho sebetsa mmoho re le mmuso, kgwebo le basebetsi ho hodisa moruo wa rona sekgahla kahodimo ho 5% hore re tle re kgone ho thea mesebetsi eo re e hlokang.

eng: fortunately this collaboration is already taking place.
sot: ka lehlohonolo tshebedisanommoho ena e se e ntse e etsahala.

eng: it is taking place at nedlac which is one of the key institutions of cooperation in our democracy, between government, business, labour and the community sector.
sot: e a etsahala ho ntshetsopele ya moruo wa naha le lekgotla la mesebetsi eo e leng se seng sa ditheo tsa bohlokwa tsa tshebedisanommoho demokrasing ya rona, dipakeng tsa makala a mmuso, kgwebo, basebetsi le setjhaba.

eng: it has taken place as well in engagements that we have been having with the business community.
sot: e etsahetse esita le dipuisanong tseo re bileng le tsona le ba kgwebo.

eng: last year i started engaging business on specific steps that government can take to make it easier to do business in our country.
sot: ngwahola ke ile ka qala ho buisana le ba kgwebo ka dikgato tse totobetseng tseo mmuso o ka di nkang ho nolofatsa ho etsa kgwebo naheng ya rona.

eng: arising out of that process, we have now streamlined regulatory and licensing approvals for environmental impact assessments, water licenses and mining licenses.
sot: ka lebaka la dipuisano tseo, jwale re hlophisitse botjha dikananelo tsa melawana le dilaesense bakeng sa ditshekatsheko tsa thefuleho ya tikoloho, dilaesense tsa metsi le dilaesense tsa merafo.

eng: parliament is finalizing amendments to the law to give effect to this very positive development, which will cut to under 300 days, the time it takes to start a mine, from application to final approvals.
sot: palamente e phethela diphetolo tsa molao e le ho fana ka monyetla wa ho thakgoha ha tswelopele e ntle ena, e tla pukutla hore matsatsi a be katlase ho 300, e leng nako ya ho qala morafo, ho tloha ho kenngweng ha kopo ho ya dikananelong tsa ho qetela.

eng: the deputy president of the republic continues to facilitate discussions between government, mining companies and labour.
sot: motlatsi wa moporesidente wa rephaboliki o tswela pele ho hlophisa dipuisano dipakeng tsa mmuso, dikhamphane tsa merafo le basebetsi.

eng: the purpose is to stabilise industrial relations in this very important sector of our economy.
sot: sepheo ke ho tsitsisa dikamano tsa indasteri lekaleng lena la bohlokwa la moruo wa rona.

eng: the process is yielding results.
sot: mosebetsi ona o tla le diphetho tse ntle.

eng: strikes in the sector were fewer and shorter last year.
sot: diteraeke tse bileng teng lekaleng di ne di le mmalwa di bile di le kgutshwane ngwahola.

eng: and more importantly, industrial relations processes are taking place in a manner consistent with the law.
sot: e nngwe ya bohlokwa le ho feta, diketsahalo tsa dikamano tsa indasteri di etsahala ka mokgwa o tsamaisanang le molao.

eng: we have intervened in mining because it is one of our key job drivers.
sot: re namotse ho tsa morafo hobane ke e nngwe ya bahlahisi ba rona ba bohlokwa ba mesebetsi.

eng: we need a mining sector that works.
sot: re hloka lekala la merafo le sebetsang.

eng: mining employs over half a million people.
sot: merafo e hira batho ba fetang halofo ya milione.

eng: it is the biggest earner of foreign exchange in our country.
sot: naheng ya rona ke yona e fumanang tjhelete e ngata ka ho fetisisa dikananyetsanong tsa bolata.

eng: it also contributes about 20 billion rand directly to the tax revenue.
sot: e boela e kenya letsoho ka tjhelete e ka bang r20 bilione ka kotloloho pokellong ya lekgetho.

eng: mining also makes a far larger contribution as a buyer of goods and services, and a supplier of inputs to other sectors of our economy and other economies around the globe.
sot: merafo e boela e kenya letsoho haholwanyane e le bareki ba dintho le ditshebeletso, ebile ke bafepedi ba dintho makaleng a mang a moruo wa rona esita le meruo e meng lefatsheng ka bophara.

eng: we are exploring partnerships with stakeholders to address the issue of housing in mining towns.
sot: re utolla selekane le ba amehang ho rarolla qaka ya matlo ditoropong tse nang le merafo.

eng: let me also remind mining companies that 2014 is the deadline for them to improve housing and living conditions of mineworkers and to achieve a number of targets.
sot: e re ke boele ke hopotse dikhamphane tsa merafo hore 2014 ke selemo sa ho qetela ho bona hore ba ntlafatse matlo le maemo a bodulo a basebetsi ba merafong esita le ho fihlella dipehelo tse ngatanyana.

eng: government continues to monitor and enforce compliance on both the company’s social and labour plans and mining charter targets.
sot: mmuso o tswela pele ho bea leihlo le ho qobella boikamahanyo mererong ya khamphane ya setjhaba le basebetsi esita le dipehelo tsa tumellano ya merafo.

eng: fellow south africans,honourable members,other than mining, we had identified five other job drivers in 2009. these are tourism, agriculture, the green economy, infrastructure development and manufacturing.
sot: maaforika borwa a heso,ditho tse hlomphehang,ntle le merafo, re hlwaile bahlahisi ba bang ba bahlano ba mesebetsi ka 2009. bona ke bohahlaudi, temo, moruo o sa thefuleng tikoloho, kaho ya meralo ya motheo le tlhahiso.

eng: the tourism industry has grown dramatically.
sot: indasteri ya bohahlaudi e hotse ka potlako.

eng: in 1993, south africa received a mere 3 million foreign visitors.
sot: ka 1993, aforika borwa e amohetse bahahlaudi ba dimilione tse tharo feela.

eng: by 2012, the figure had grown to 13 million visitors.
sot: ka 2012, lenane leo le hotse ho ya ho dimilione tse 13 tsa baeti.

eng: we will continue to grow this industry, given its potential for job creation.
sot: re tla tswela pele ho hodisa indasteri ena, ka lebaka la bokgoni ba yona ba tlhahiso ya mesebetsi.

eng: in 2012 we unveiled the national infrastructure plan, led by the president through the presidential infrastructure coordinating commission.
sot: ka 2012 re utollotse morero wa meralo ya motheo ya naha, o etelletsweng pele ke moporesidente ka khomishene ya moporesidente ya tlhophiso ya meralo ya motheo.

eng: we have subsequently invested one trillion rand in public infrastructure over the past five years.
sot: ka lebaka leo re tsetetse trilione e le nngwe ya diranta meralong ya motheo ya setjhaba dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng.

eng: many of the projects are completed or are nearing completion.
sot: diprojeke tse ngata di se di phethetswe kapa di mathuleng a ho phethelwa.

eng: i will mention just a few.
sot: ke tla ama tse mmalwa feela.

eng: the rea vaya system in joburg is now used by more than 100 000 gauteng residents.
sot: tsamaiso ya rea vaya ya johannesburg jwale e se e sebediswa ke baahi ba gauteng ba fetang 100 000. ditsamaiso tse tshwanang le eo di a ahwa motse kapa, tshwane, koung ya nelson mandela, buffalo city, ethekwini le rusternburg.

eng: the country’s harbours and ports have been improved.
sot: boemakepe le madiboho tsa naha di ntlafaditswe.

eng: we have built a 700 kilometre fuel pipeline from durban to gauteng to transport 4 billion cubic litres of petrol, diesel and jet fuel a year.
sot: re ahile peipi e tsamaisang mafura ya bolelele ba dikilomitara tse 700 ho tloha durban ho ya gauteng ho tsamaisa dilithara tse bilione tsa peterole, tsa disile le mafura a difofane ka selemo.

eng: close to 1 500 kilometres of new roads or lanes have been built.
sot: mebila kapa mela e metjha e ka etsang dikilomithara tse 1 500 e se e ahilwe.

eng: this progress in respect of roads reminds us of those who have served in this government before who wanted the best for the country, such as our former transport minister mr dullar omar.
sot: kgatelopele e mabapi le mebila e re hopotsa bao ba kileng ba sebeletsa mmuso ona pele, ba neng ba batla tse ntlentle bakeng sa naha ena, ba kang letona la mehleng la dipalangwang ntate dullar omar.

eng: his dear wife farieda is one of our guests this evening.
sot: mofumahadi wa hae mme farieda ke e mong wa baeti ba rona ba bohlokwa phirimaneng ena.

eng: the construction of new rail lines has started in mpumalanga, to ease the pressure off the roads.
sot: kaho ya diporo tse ntjha e se e qadile mpumalanga, ho fokotsa tshubuhlellano mebileng.

eng: the gautrain project is now fully functional and carries over 1,2 million passengers a month.
sot: projeke ya gautrain jwale e sebetsa ka ho phethahetseng mme e pepa bapalami ba 1,2 ya dimilione ka kgwedi.

eng: the passenger rail agency of south africa will spend over 120 billion rand over the next 10 years to buy new trains.
sot: eijensi ya diterene tsa baeti ya aforika borwa e tla sebedisa tjhelete e fetang r120 bilione dilemong tse 10 tse tlang ho reka diterene.

eng: transnet is implementing its massive 300 billion rand market demand strategy, building much needed transport infrastructure.
sot: transnet e kenya tshebetsong lewa la yona le leholohadi la kgolo ya mebaraka la diranta tse dibilione tse 300,mme e aha meralo ya metheo e hlokehang haholo ya dipalangwang.

eng: to realise the economic potential of the western cape and the west coast, we launched the saldanha industrial development zone and opened two new factories in atlantis.
sot: ho ananela bokgoni ba moruo wa kapa bophirimela le lebopo la bophirimela, re thakgotse lebatowa la ntshetsopele ya indasteri ya saldanha ra ba ra bula difeme tse pedi tse ntjha atlantis.

eng: to improve the water supply, two large new dams were completed, de hoop in limpopo and spring grove in kwazulu-natal, while phase 2 of the lesotho highlands water project is to be launched soon.
sot: ho ntlafatsa phepelo ya metsi, matamo a mabedi a maholo a matjha a phethetswe, de hoop e limpopo le spring grove e kwazulu-natala, ha mokgahlelo wa bobedi wa projeke ya metsi a dihlaba a lesotho e tla thakgolwa haufinyane.

eng: construction is continuing at the new power stations, medupi in limpopo, kusile in mpumalanga and ingula near ladysmith, employing more than 30 000 workers.
sot: kaho e tswela pele diteisheneng tse ntjha tsa motlakase, medupi e limpopo, kusile e mpumalanga le ingula e haufi le ladysmith, tse hirileng basebetsi ba fetang 30 000. re tswela pele ho utolla mehlodi e meng ya eneji, ho ya ka morero o kopantsweng wa eneji.

eng: we continue to explore other sources of energy, in line with the integrated resource plan for energy.
sot: ho etswa peteroliamo, haholoholo kgase ya shale, ho tla tlisa phetoho e kgolo lebatoweng la karoo le moruong wa aforika borwa.

eng: the development of petroleum, especially shale gas will be a game-changer for the karoo region and the south african economy.
sot: kamora ho sekaseka dikotsi le menyetla, melawana ya ho qetela e tla ntshuwa haufinyane mme e tla latelwa ke ho etswa le ho neanwa ha dilaesense.

eng: having evaluated the risks and opportunities, the final regulations will be released soon and will be followed by the processing and granting of licenses.
sot: re lebelletse ho phethela phumantsho ya dimegawatt tsa eneji ya nutlilere tse 9 600. baetsi ba mafura ba se ba kgethilwe mme ba se ba qadile ka mosebetsi.

eng: honourable membersours is indeed a country at work and is a much better place to live in.
sot: ditho tse hlomphehanghwa rona ke naha e keneng kgabong mme ke sebaka se betetshana ho phela ho sona.

eng: we must keep the momentum.
sot: re tlameha ho boloka morolo oo.

eng: honourable members,more of our wealth is created through the internet or telecommunication.
sot: ditho tse hlomphehang,boholo ba maruo a rona bo thewa ka inthanete kapa dikgokahanyo tsa difonofono.

eng: a 37 000 kilometres of fibre-optic cable has been laid by the private and public sectors in the past five years.
sot: kheibole ya faeba ya bolelele ba dikilomitara tse 37 000 e kentswe ke makala a mmuso le setjhaba dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng.

eng: this will be significantly expanded in the years ahead.
sot: sena se tla atollwa ka sekgahla se seholo dilemong tse tlang.

eng: we are proud of our successes in science and technology.
sot: re motlotlo ka dikatleho tsa rona ho saense le thekenoloji.

eng: the construction of the first telescope of the 64-dish forerunner to the square kilometre array, the meerkat, will be completed in the first quarter of 2014. honourable members,our incentives to boost manufacturing have yielded returns.
sot: kaho ya thelesekoupu ya pele ya dikotlolo tse 64 pokellong ya sekwere sa kilomithara, meerkat, e tla phethelwa sehleng sa pele sa 2014. ditho tse hlomphehang,ditsiane tsa rona tsa ho tshehetsa tlhahiso di tlile le dipoelo.

eng: the automotive investment scheme that was launched in 2009 has approved a total 3.8 billion rand worth of incentives for about 160 investment projects.
sot: sekema sa matsete ho tsa makoloi se ileng sa thakgolwa ka 2009 se ananetse ditsiane tsa boleng ba diranta tse dibilione tse 3.8 bakeng sa matsete a diprojeke tse ka bang 160. diprojeke tsena di boloka mesebetsi e fetang dikete tse 50. dikhamphane di tla aha makoloi a manyenyane, ditekesi le dibese.

eng: we have stabilised the clothing, textile, leather and footwear sector, which had been shedding jobs.
sot: re tsitsisitse lekala le nnileng la fadisa mesebetsi la diaparo, masela, letlalo le dieta.

eng: several industries have been designated for local content.
sot: diindasteri tse ngatanyana di hahamalletse dihlahisweng tsa kahare ho naha.

eng: these include buses, canned vegetables, clothing, textiles, leather and footwear and other goods.
sot: tsena di akga dibese, meroho e ka makanekaneng, diaparo, masela, letlalo le dieta le dintho tse ding.

eng: we have concrete examples of the success of the localisation programme.
sot: re na le mehlala e bonahalang ya katleho ya lenaneo la dihlahiswa tsa kahare ho naha.

eng: in the past two years alone, more than 20 000 minibus taxis and 330 buses were assembled locally, drawing investment and development to our cities.
sot: dilemong tse pedi tse fetileng feela, ditekesi tse fetang 20 000 le dibese tse 330 di ile tsa kgobokanngwa kwano lapeng, seo se tlisa matsete le ntshetsopele ditoropong tsa rona tse kgolo.

eng: in the next five years, the state will procure at least 75% of its goods and services from south african producers.
sot: dilemong tse hlano tse tlang, mmuso o tla fumana 75% ya disebediswa le ditshebeletso tsa wona ho bahlahisi ba aforika borwa.

eng: fellow south africans,we have to work more intensively to develop emerging or black industrialists.
sot: maaforika borwa a heso,re tshwanela ho sebetsa ka boikitlaetso bo tomanyana ho ntshetsapele diindasteri tse thuthuang kapa tsa batho ba batsho.

eng: many of the aspirant black industrialists complain about the difficulties they experience in obtaining industrial finance, supplier and retail markets, and technical production support.
sot: bongata ba baindasteri ba batsho ba nang le thahasello ba tletleba ka mathata ao ba teanang le wona ho fumaneng ditjhelete tsa diindasteri, bafepedi le mebaraka ya thekiso, le tshehetso ya tlhahiso e bonahalang.

eng: the national empowerment fund, the industrial development corporation and the small enterprise finance agency will continue to provide finance to viable black-owned businesses to promote industrialisation.
sot: letlole la naha la matlafatso, koporasi ya ntshetsopele ya diindasteri le eijensi ya ditjhelete tsa dikgwebo tse nyenyane di tla tswela pele ho fana ka ditjhelete dikgwebong tse mahlahahlaha tsa batho ba batsho ho phahamisa ntshetsopele ya diindasteri.

eng: in addition, we encourage established businesses to support the development of black industrial businesses.
sot: ho feta moo, re kgothaletsa dikgwebo tse kgolo ho tshehetsa dikgwebo tsa diindasteri tsa batho ba batsho.

eng: agriculture is a key job driver and a provider of opportunities for entrepreneurship.
sot: temo ke e nngwe ya bohlokwa tlhahisong ya mesebetsi mme e fana ka menyetla ya kgwebo.

eng: our agricultural support programme, fetsa tlala, is producing brand new exporters.
sot: lenaneo la rona la tshehetso ho tsa temo, fetsa tlala, le hlahisa bahwebi ba batjha ba diyantle.

eng: the first 88 smallholder farmers in this programme supplied the united nations world food programme with 268 tons of maize and beans to send to lesotho last month.
sot: dihwai tsa pele tse thuthuang tse 88 tse lenaneong lena, di fepetse lenaneo la dijo la lefatshe la matjhaba a kopaneng ka ditone tse 268 tsa poone le dinawa ho romela lesotho kgweding e fetileng.

eng: we expect this number to increase.
sot: re lebeletse hore palo ena e eketsehe.

eng: we will continue to promote our fisheries sector as well, which contributes an estimated 6billion rand to the economy and provides 27 000 jobs.
sot: re tla tswela pele le ho phahamisa lekala la rona la botshwasi ba ditlhapi, le kenyang letsoho ka tjhelete e hakanyetswang r6 bilione moruong athe le fana ka mesebetsi e 27 000. ditho tse hlomphehang,re entse kgatelopele e ntle haholo lenaneong la kabobotjha ya mobu.

eng: since 1994, nearly 5,000 farms, comprising 4.2 million hectares, have been transferred to black people, benefiting over 200,000 families.
sot: haesale ho tloha ka 1994 mapolasi a ka bang 5 000, a boholo ba dihektare tse dimilione tse 4.2, a neilwe batho ba batsho, mme malapa a fetang 200 000 a fola molemo.

eng: nearly 80,000 land claims, totaling 3.4 million hectares, have been settled and 1.8 million people have benefited.
sot: ditseko tsa mobu tse ka bang 80 000, tse akaretsang dihektare tse dimilione tse 3.4, di phethetswe mme batho ba dimilione tse 1.8 ba fotse molemo.

eng: the next administration will need to take forward a number of policy, legislative and practical interventions, to further redress the dispossession of our people of their land.
sot: botsamaisi bo latelang bo tla tshwanela ho ntshetsapele dikgato tse ngatanyana tsa bokenadipakeng tse kang maano, ketso ya melao le tse ding tse bonahalang, ho tswela pele ho busetsa madulong taba ya kamoho ya mobu bathong ba habo rona.

eng: these include matters relating to the establishment of the office of the valuer-general and thereby opening of the lodgement of claims.
sot: tsena di akga dintho tse amanang le ho thewa ha kantoro ya molekodi kakaretso wa boleng ebe ho bulelwa ho kenngwa ha ditseko.

eng: honourable memberssouth africa is indeed a much better place to live in.
sot: ditho tse hlomphehangkannete aforika borwa ke sebaka se betere seo ho ka phelwang ho sona.

eng: let me now report on our social transformation programme.
sot: e re jwale ke tlalehe ka lenaneo la rona la phetoho setjhabeng.

eng: education is a ladder out of poverty for millions of our people.
sot: thuto ke leri e nyollang matshweletshwele a batho ba habo rona bofumeng.

eng: we are happy therefore that there is a huge increase in the enrolment of children in school, from pre-primary to tertiary level.
sot: kahoo, re thabile ka hore ho na le keketseho e kgolo boingodisong ba bana dikolong, ho tloha sekolong sa dikonyana ho ya boemong ba thuto e phahameng.

eng: the number of children attending grade r has more than doubled, moving from about 300 thousand to more than 700 thousand between 2003 and 2011. a draft policy framework towards universal access to grade r has been gazetted for public comment, with a view to making grade r compulsory.
sot: palo ya bana ba ithutang kereiting ya r e eketsehile ho feta habedi, e tloha ho palo e ka bang 300 000 ho ya ho e fetang 700 000 dipakeng tsa 2003 le 2011. moralo wa nakwana wa leano o lebisang phihlellong e akaretsang ho kereiti ya r o se o hlophiseditswe tshwaelo ya setjhaba, ka sepheo sa ho etsa hore dithuto tsa kereiti ya r di tlame.

eng: bakwethu,izingane ezingu 8 million azikhokhiesikoleni, kantiezingu 9 million ithola ukudla okunempilo ezikoleni okuphuma kuhulumeni, ukuze zifunde kahle zingabulawa indlala.
sot: baheso,bana ba dimlione tse 8 ha ba lefe dikolong, athe ba dimilione tse 9 ba fumana dijo tse nang le phepo tse tswang mmusong dikolong, hore ba tle ba ithute hantle ba se ke ba bolawa ke tlala.

eng: )the matric pass rate has gone up from around 61 percent in 2009 to 78 percent last year and the bachelor passes improve each year.
sot: sekgahla sa ho atleha dithutong tsa materiki se nyolohile ho tloha ho 61% ka 2009 ho ya ho 78% ngwahola, athe dikatleho tsa ho ya ithuta diyunivesithi di ntlafala selemo le selemo.

eng: through the annual national assessments, we keep track of improvements and interventions needed, especially, in maths and science.
sot: ka ditlhahlobo tsa naha tsa selemo, re lekola dintlafalo le dikgato tsa bokenadipakeng tse hlokehang, haholoholo ho metshe le saense.

eng: to promote inclusivity and diversity, the south african sign language curriculum will be offered in schools from next year, 2015. we have increased our numbers of literate adults through the kha ri gude programme from 2,2 million in 2008 to 3 million people.
sot: ho phahamisa taba ya ho kenyeletswa ha ba bang le ho kopana ka ho se tshwane, kharikhulamo ya puo ya matshwao ya aforika borwa e tla rutwa dikolong ho tloha isao, ka 2015. re ekeditse manane a batho ba baholo ba tsebang ho bala le ho ngola ka lenaneo la kha ri gude ho tloha bathong ba dimilione tse 2,2 ka 2008 ho ya ho ba dimilione tse 3. re ne re ntse re tsetela le thupelong ya matitjhere mme re bula botjha dikholetjhe tsa thupelo ya matitjhere hore re rarolle bothata ba tlhokeho.

eng: we have also been investing in teacher training and are re-opening teacher training colleges to meet the demand.
sot: ho kutla tikoloho e ntle e loketseng ho ithuta, re ahile dikolo tse ntjha tse 370 re fedisa dikolo tse ahilweng ka mobu le meaho e meng e boemong bo bobe naha ka bophara.

eng: the programme continues.
sot: lenaneo leo le tswela pele.

eng: compatriotswe have a good story to tell in higher education as well.
sot: bahesore na le pale e monate eo re ka e phetang le ka thuto ya boemo bo phahameng.

eng: student enrolments at universities increased by 12% while further education and training college enrolments have increased by 90%.
sot: boingodiso ba baithuti bo eketsehile ka 12% diyunivesithing, ha boingodiso ba dikholetjhe tsa thuto le thupelo e tswellang (fet) bo eketsehile ka 90%.

eng: we have increased the budgets of the national student financial aid scheme to 9 billion rand to meet the rising demand.
sot: re ekeditse dibajete tsa sekema sa naha sa thuso ya ditjhelete ha baithuti ho ya ho r9 bilione ho arabela ditlhokehong tse ntseng di eketseha.

eng: another major achievement of this term has been the establishment of two brand new universities, sol plaatje in the northern cape and the university of mpumalanga.
sot: katleho e nngwe e kgolo ya sehla sena e bile ho thewa ha diyunivesithi tse ntjha tse pedi, sol plaatjie e kapa leboya le yunivesithi ya mpumalanga.

eng: we will also build 12 new fet colleges in limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal and eastern cape.
sot: re tla boela re aha dikholetjhe tsa fet tse 12 tse ntjha limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal le kapa botjhabela.

eng: compatriots,the launch of the national education collaboration framework last year was an important development for the country.
sot: baheso,ho thakgolwa ha moralo wa naha wa setlamo sa thuto ngwahola e ne e le tswelopele ya bohlokwa ya naha ya rona.

eng: we wish the team well in their national duty.
sot: re ba lakaletsa katleho mosebetsing wa bona wa naha.

eng: compatriots,we have a good story to tell in the improvement of health care too.
sot: baheso,re na le pale e monate eo re ka e phetang esita le dintlafalong tsa bophelo bo botle.

eng: over the past five years, 300 new health facilities have been built, including 160 new clinics.
sot: dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng, ditsi tsa bophelo bo botle tse 300 tse ntjha di ahilwe, ho akga le ditleliniki tse ntjha tse 160. dipetlele tse ntjha tse leshome di ahilwe kapa di ntjhafaditswe ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, seterekeng sa vryburg, swartruggens, khayelitsha le mitchell’s plain.

eng: ten new hospitals have been builtor refurbished in ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, vryburg district, swartruggens, khayelitsha and mitchell’s plain.
sot: motsamaisi wa dipuisano ya hlomphehangmodulasetulo wa ncop ya hlomphehangkatleho ho tsa hiv le aids ke e nngwe ya dikatleho tse kgolohadi tsa botsamaisi bona mme re sebediswa jwaloka naha eo e leng mohlala ke mananeo a aids a matjhaba a kopaneng, (unaids).

eng: honourable speakerhonourable chairperson of the ncopthe hiv and aids turnaround is one of the biggest achievements of this administration and we are used as a model country by the united nations aids programmes, (unaids).
sot: phetisetso ya hiv ho tloha ho mme ho ya ngwaneng e theohile haholo mme re phetaphetile lenane la batho ba fumanang meriana ya antiretrovaerale, ho tloha bathong ba milione e le nngwe ho ya ho ba dimilione tse 2.4 ka 2013. maaforika borwa a fetang dimilione tse 20 a entse diteko tsa hiv haesale ho tloha ho thakgolweng ha letsholo ka 2011, e leng sesupo sa boitshepo tsamaisong ya bophelo bo botle.

eng: south africans are now living longer.
sot: maaforika borwa jwale a phela bophelo bo boleletsana.

eng: the target for the next administration is to ensure that at least 4.6 million people are enrolled in the anti-retroviral programme.
sot: pehelo ya botsamaisi bo tlang ke ho netefatsa hore bonnyane batho ba dimilione tse 4.6 ba a kenngwa lenaneong la diantiretrovaerale.

eng: we acknowledge the contribution of the south african national aids council for the hard work.
sot: re ananela seabo sa lekgotla la naha la aids la aforika borwa ka mosebetsi o boima oo le o etsang.

eng: while celebrating our success, we must not be complacent.
sot: ha re ntse re keteka katleho ya rona, ha re a tshwanela ho qhanolla.

eng: the prevention work must still continue so that we can reach that goal of zero hiv infections sooner.
sot: mosebetsi wa thibelo o tlameha hore o nne o tswele pele ho etsetsa hore re fihlelle sepheo sa phediso ya ditshwaetso tsa hiv haufinyane.

eng: at a broader level, we will enter a new phase in the implementation of the national health insurance programme which will extend quality healthcare to the poor.
sot: ka bobatsi, re tla kena mokgahlelong o motjha ho kenngweng tshebetsong ha lenaneo la inshorense ya naha ya bophelo bo botle.

eng: honourable chairperson of the ncop,honourable speakerthe overall crime rate has decreased by 21 percent since 2002 and work is ongoing to make communities safer.
sot: modulasetulo wa ncop ya hlomphehang,motsamaisi wa dipuisano ya hlomphehangsekgahla sa ditlolo tsa molao ka kakaretso se fokotsehile ka 21% haesale ho tloha ka 2002 mme mosebetsi wa ho etsa hore dibaka di bolokehe o ntse o tswela pele.

eng: one of the key focus areas is to eradicate violence against women and children.
sot: e nngwe ya dintho tseo re tsepamisitseng maikutlo ho tsona ke ho fediswa ha dikgoka kgahlanong le basadi le bana.

eng: we have introduced a number of measures to respond to this challenge.
sot: re se re entse dikgato tse ngatanyana tsa ho rarolla phephetso ena.

eng: these include the reopening of the family violence, child protection and sexual offences units as well as the sexual offences courts.
sot: tsena di akga ho bulwa botjha ha diyuniti tsa dikgoka tsa malapeng, tshireletso ya bana le ditlolo tsa molao tsa motabo esita le makgotla a dinyewe a ditlolo tsa molao ho tsa motabo.

eng: we thank the many ngos that promote the rights of women and children who contribute positively to this important work.
sot: re leboha mekgatlo e mengata eo e seng ya mmuso e phahamisang ditokelo tsa basadi le tsa bana, e bileng le seabo se setle mosebetsing ona wa bohlokwa.

eng: our country continues to be the target of rhino poachers.
sot: naha ya rona e ntse e tswela pele ho ba phofu ya batlatlapi ba ditshukudu.

eng: our law enforcement agencies are working hard to arrest this scourge.
sot: dieijensi tsa rona tsa qobello ya molao di sebetsa ka thata ho fedisa sewa sena.

eng: we have also reached agreements with china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique and other sadc countries to work together to stop this crime.
sot: re se re entse ditumellano le china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique le dinaha tse ding tsa dinaha tse tswelang pele tsa aforika e ka borwa (sadc) ho sebedisana mmoho ho fedisa ditlolo tsena tsa molao.

eng: we thank the business community and all south africans who participate in the campaign to save the rhino.
sot: re leboha ba kgwebo le maaforika borwa ohle a bileng le seabo letsholong la ho boloka ditshukudu.

eng: compatriotsthe independence of the judiciary has been further enhanced by the establishment of the office of the chief justice as a separate institution from the department of justice and constitutional development.
sot: bahesoboikemelo ba boahlodi bo boetse ba ntlafatswa ka ho thewa ha kantoro ya moahlodi e moholo e le setheo se kathoko ho lefapha la toka le ntshetsopele ya molaotheo.

eng: we have passed several pieces of legislation to support this new role of the office of the chief justice.
sot: re se re ananetse melao e mengatanyana ya ho tshehetsa seabo sena se setjha sa kantoro ya moahlodi e moholo.

eng: progress is being made in the transformation of the judiciary to reflect the race and gender demographics of the country.
sot: kgatelopele e ntse e etswa phetohong ya boahlodi hore bo bontshe palo e nepahetseng ya setjhaba mabapi le merabe le bong naheng ya rona.

eng: the chief justice of the republic continues to champion and lead this transformation.
sot: moahlodi e moholo wa rephaboliki o tswela pele ho tshehetsa le ho etella pele phetoho ena.

eng: black judges (african, indian and coloured) now constitute 61% of all judges.
sot: baahlodi ba batsho (maaforika, maindian le ba mmala) jwale ba etsa 61% ya baahlodi bohle.

eng: however, the acute under-representation of women on the bench remains of concern.
sot: leha ho le jwalo, boemedi bo fokolang haholo ba basadi ditulong tsa boahlodi e dula e ntse e ngongorehisa.

eng: of the judicial establishment of 239 judges, only 76 are women.
sot: motheong wa boahlodi o nang le baahlodi ba 239, ke feela ba 76 ba eleng basadi.

eng: the challenge is to transform the legal profession broadly in order to nourish the pool from which female judges can be appointed.
sot: phephetso ke ho fetola porofeshene ya tsa molao ka bobatsi ka sepheo sa ho nontsha sehlopha seo baahlodi ba basadi ba ka thonngwang ho tloha ho sona.

eng: the finalisation of the legal practice bill will assist to broaden the pool from which potential judicial officers could be selected.
sot: ho phethelwa ha sekamolao sa ho sebetsa ka tsa molao ho tla thusa ho atolla sesiu seo bahlanka ba tshwanelehileng ba tsa boahlodi ba ka kgethwang ho tswa ho sona.. motsamaisi wa dipuisano ya hlomphehang le modulasetulo,maaforika borwa a kopane ka ho labalabela setjhaba se hlokang bonyofonyofo.

eng: since the launch of the national anti-corruption hotline by the public service commission, over 13 000 cases of corruption and maladministration have been referred to government departments for further handling and investigation.
sot: twantsho ya bonyofonyofo kahare ho tshebeletso ya setjhaba ho bea ditholwana tse ntlehaesale ho tloha ha khomishene ya tshebeletso ya setjhaba e ne e thakgola mohala wa naha wa mahala wa ho tlaleha diketso tsa bonyofonyofo, ditlaleho tse fetang 13 000 tsa bonyofonyofo le botsamaisi bo soro di se di fetiseditswe mafapheng a mmuso bakeng sa tshekatsheko le dipatlisiso tse tomanyana.

eng: government has recovered more than 320-million rand from perpetrators through the national anti-corruption hotline.
sot: mmuso o se o kgutlisitse tjhelete e fetang r320 milione ho tswa ho balotsana bao ka thuso ya mohala wa naha wa mahala wa ho tlaleha diketso tsa bonyofonyofo.

eng: some of the successes of the national anti-corruption hotline include the following:to prevent corruption in the supply chain system, government has decided to establish a central tender board to adjudicate tenders in all spheres of government.
sot: tse ding tsa dikatleho tsa mohala wa naha wa mahala wa ho tlaleha diketso tsa bonyofonyofo di akga tse latelang:ho thibela bonyofonyofo tsamaisong ya ho rekwa le ho rekiswa ha dintho, mmuso o qetile ka ho thea boto e le nngwe e sebetsanang le dithendara feela ho aba dithendara makaleng ohle a mmuso.

eng: this body will work with the chief procurement officer whose main function will be to check on pricing and adherence to procedures as well as fairness.
sot: lekgotla lena le tla sebetsa le mohlanka e moholo wa phumantsho eo mosebetsi wa hae o ka sehloohong e tla ba ho hlahloba sekepele sa ditheko le tsitlallelo ho mekgwatsamaiso esita le tlhokeho ya leeme.

eng: the special investigating unit is investigating maladministration or alleged corruption in a number of government departments and state entities, through 40 proclamations signed by the president during this administration.
sot: yuniti e ikgethileng ya dipatlisiso e batlisisa ka botsamaisi bo soro kapa dipelaelo tsa bonyofonyofo mafapheng a mangatanyana a mmuso le ditheong tsa mmuso, ka dikgoeletso tse 40 tse tekennweng ke moporesidente nakong ya botsamaisi bona.

eng: we will keep the public informed of the outcome of the investigations.
sot: re tla dula re ntse re beile setjhaba sehlohlolong sa ditaba ka sephetho sa dipatlisiso.

eng: in the first six months of last year, the asset forfeiture unit paid a total of 149 million rand into the criminal assets recovery account and to the victims of crime.
sot: dikgweding tsa pele tse tsheletseng tsa ngwahola, yuniti ya kgapo ya thepa e fumanweng ka bonokwane e lefile tjhelete e diranta tse dimilione tse 149 akhaonteng ya pusetso ya thepa e fumanweng ka ditlolo tsa molao le ho mahlatsipa a ditlolo tsa molao.

eng: this is 170% above its target of 55 million rand and is higher than it has ever achieved in a full year.
sot: ke 170% kahodimo ho pehelo ya yona ya r55 milione mme e kahodimo ho feta e ngata eo e kileng ya e fumana ka selemo se tletseng.

eng: last year, the competition authorities investigated large-scale price fixing in the construction industry and fined guilty companies 1.4 billion rand.
sot: ngwahola, ba ikarabellang ho tsa ditlhodisano ba fupuditse ho nyollwa ho seng molaong ha ditheko indastering ya kaho mme ba ahlola dikhamphane tse molato r1.4 bilione.

eng: further steps against those involved are now underway.
sot: dikgato tse ding tse kgahlanong le bao ba amehang di se di le motjheng.

eng: compatriots,i would now like to touch briefly on the provision of basic services to our people.
sot: baheso,jwale ke lakatsa ho ama ka bokgutshwane tsa phano ya ditshebeletso tsa mantlha bathong ba habo rona.

eng: over the past 20 years, remarkable achievements have been made in increasing access to services such as water, sanitation and electricity.
sot: dilemong tse 20 tse fetileng, ho entswe dikatleho tse babatsehang keketsehong ya phihlello ditshebeletsong tse kang metsi, tsamaiso ya dikgwerekgwere le motlakase.

eng: government has begun an intensive programme to eliminate the bucket system as part of restoring the dignity of our people.
sot: mmuso o se o qadile ka mosebetsi o matla wa ho fedisa matlwana a mabakethe e le karolo ya ho kgutlisa seriti sa batho ba rona.

eng: phase one of the programme will eradicate buckets in formalized townships of the free state, eastern cape and northern cape.
sot: mokgahlelo wa pele wa mosebetsi ona o tla fedisa matlwana a mabakethe makeisheneng a freistata, kapa botjhabela le kapa leboya.

eng: phase two will eradicate buckets in informal settlements in all provinces.
sot: mokgahlelo wa bobedi o tla fedisa matlwana a mabakethe dibakeng tsa baipehi diporofenseng tsohle.

eng: in housing, about 3 million housing units and more than 855 thousand serviced sites were delivered since 1994. nearly 500 informal settlements have been replaced with quality housing and basic services over the past five years.
sot: ho tsa matlo, diyuniti tse ka bang dimlione tse tharo tsa matlo le ditsha tse nang le ditshebeletso tse fetang 855 000 di filwe batho haesale ho tloha ka 1994. dibaka tsa baipehi tse ka bang 500 di heleditswe mme ha ahwa matlo a boleng a nang le ditshebeletso tsa mantlha dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng.

eng: the next administration will promote better located mixed income housing projects.
sot: botsamaisi bo latelang bo tla kgothaletsa diprojeke tsa matlo tse dibakeng tse betere bakeng sa ba amohelang meputso e fapafapaneng.

eng: compatriots,some communities still do not have these services especially in informal settlements and rural areas.
sot: baheso,dibaka tse ding di sa ntse di se na ditshebeletso tsena, haholoholo dibaka tsa baipehi le tsa mahaeng.

eng: we are therefore working with all spheres of government to ensure the provision of these services, especially in the 23 municipalities with the greatest number of backlogs.
sot: kahoo, re sebetsa le makala ohle a mmuso ho netefatsa phano ya ditshebeletso tsena, haholoholo bomasepaleng ba 23 ba nang le palo e hodimodimo ya ditshallomorao.

eng: compatriotsin last year’s state of the nation address, i raised my concern with the manifestation of violence in some of the protests taking place in our country.
sot: bahesopuong ya boemo ba naha ya ngwahola, ke ile ka hlahisa ngongoreho ya ka ka ho fehlwa ha merusu boipelaetsong bo bong bo etsahalang naheng ya rona.

eng: violent protests have taken place again around the country in the past few weeks.
sot: boipelaetso bo nang le merusu bo etsahetse hape naha ka bophara dibekeng tse mmalwa tse fetileng.

eng: also worrying is what appears to be premeditated violence, as is the case with the use of petrol bombs and other weapons during protests.
sot: ntho e nngwe hape e ngongorehisang ke se bonahalang eka ke merusu e rerilweng ka hloko, jwaloka diketsahalo moo ho sebedisitsweng diqhomane tsa peterole le dihlomo tse ding nakong ya boipelaetso.

eng: the democratic government supports the right of citizens to express themselves.
sot: mmuso wa demokrasi o tshehetsa tokelo ya baahi ya ho hlahisa maikutlo a bona.

eng: the right to protest, peacefully and unarmed, is enshrined in the constitution.
sot: tokelo ya ho ipelaetsa, ka kgotso ho bile ho sa hlomelwa, e fuperwe ke molaotheo.

eng: however, when protests threaten lives and property and destroy valuable infrastructure intended to serve the community, they undermine the very democracy that upholds the right to protest.
sot: leha ho le jwalo, ha boipelaetso bo thefula maphelo le thepa bo bile bo ruthutha meralo ya motheo e reretsweng ho sebeletsa setjhaba, bo tella yona demokrasi ena e fupereng tokelo ya ho ipelaetsa.

eng: the dominant narrative in the case of the protests in south africa has been to attribute them to alleged failures of government.
sot: tletlebo e ka sehloohong mabapi le boipelaetso bohle bo aforika borwa e tshetlehilwe qosong ya ho hloleha ha mmuso ho fana ka ditshebeletso.

eng: however the protests are not simply the result of “failures” of government but also of the success in delivering basic services.
sot: leha ho le jwalo, boipelaetso bona ha se sephetho sa ho “hloleha” ha mmuso ho fana ka ditshebeletso feela, empa hape ke ba katleho phanong ya ditshebeletso tsa mantlha.

eng: when 95% of households have access to water, the 5% who still need to be provided for, feel they cannot wait a moment longer.
sot: ha malapa a 95% a na le metsi, a 5% a ntseng a hloka ho kenyetswa metsi, a ikutlwa hore a ke ke a hlola a ema nako e teletsana.

eng: success is also the breeding ground of rising expectations.
sot: katleho e boela e ba yona e tswalang ditebello tse ntseng di eketseha.

eng: let me also add honourable members, that any loss of life at the hands of the police in the course of dealing with the protests cannot be overlooked or condoned.
sot: ere ke boele ke eketse ditho tse hlomphehang, hore ho bolawa ha motho a le diatleng tsa sepolesa nakong ya ho sebetsana le boipelaetso ho ke ke ha tlodiswa mahlo hodimo kapa ha iphapanyetswa hona.

eng: loss of life is not a small matter.
sot: ho shwa ha motho ha se ntho e nyane.

eng: we need to know what happened, why it happened.
sot: re batla ho tseba se etsahetseng, hobaneng se etsahetse.

eng: any wrongdoing must be dealt with and corrective action must be taken.
sot: phoso efe kapa efe e tlameha ho lokiswa mme kgato ya kgalemo e tlameha ho nkuwa.

eng: police must act within the ambit of the law at all times.
sot: sepolesa se tlameha ho sebetsa se ikamahantse le molao ka dinako tsohle.

eng: having said this, we should also as a society be concerned that between 2005 and 2013, close to 800 police officerswere killed.
sot: ka ho rialo, re tshwanela hore re ngongorehe re le setjhaba ka hore dipakeng tsa 2005 le 2013 mapolesa a ka bang 800 a bolailwe.

eng: the police are protectors and are the buffer between a democratic society based on the rule of law, and anarchy.
sot: mapolesa ke batshireletsi ebile ke thebe dipakeng tsa setjhaba sa demokrasi le qhomatsi.

eng: as we hold the police to account, we should be careful not to end up delegitimising them and glorify anarchy in our society.
sot: ha re ntse re bea sepolesa molato, re tshwanela ho ba sedi hore re se ke ra qetella re se qheletse ka thoko ho molao ebe re tlotla qhomatsi setjhabeng sa rona.

eng: the culture of violence originated from the apartheid past.
sot: mohlodi wa tlwaelo ya merusu ke kgethollo ya nako e fetileng.

eng: we need to conduct anintrospectionin our efforts to get rid of this scourge.
sot: re tshwanela ho etsa boitekolo matsapeng a rona a ho fedisa sewa sena.

eng: as leaders from all walks of life, we must reflect on what we did or did not do, to systematically root out the violence that surfaced in protests during the early days of our democracy.
sot: jwaloka baetapele ba tswang mahlakoreng ohle, re tshwanela ho lekola seo re se entseng kapa seo re sa se etsang, hore re tsetolle merusu e ropohileng boipelaetsong nakong ya ditshiu tsa pele tsa demokrasi ya rona.

eng: we have a collective responsibility to build a society that respects the rule of law, respects one another and which respects life and property.
sot: re na le boikarabelo ba kopanelo ba ho aha setjhaba se hlomphang molao, se itlhomphang se bile se hlompha bophelo le thepa.

eng: we should work together to rebuild ubuntu and a culture of responsibility in our society.
sot: re tshwanela ho sebetsa mmoho ho aha botjha botho le tlwaelo ya ho ba le boikarabelo setjhabeng sa habo rona.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,a decision has been taken to improve functioning of local government.
sot: motsamaisi wa dipuisano ya hlomphehang,modulasetulo wa ncop ya hlomphehang,e se e nkilwe qeto ya ho ntlafatsa tshebetso ya mmuso wa dibaka.

eng: the amendment of the municipal systems act is intended to improve the capacity of municipalities to deliver services.
sot: phetolo ya mekgwatshebetso ya bomasepala e reretswe ho ntlafatsa bokgoni ba bomasepala ba ho fana ka ditshebeletso.

eng: qualified and experienced personnel must be deployed in municipalities.
sot: basebetsi ba nang le mangolo le boiphihlelo ba tlameha ho hirwa bomasepaleng.

eng: we also need to strengthen existing forums of people’s participation and enable our people to play a greater role in development.
sot: re tshwanela le ho matlafatsa diforamo tse seng di le teng tsa seabo sa batho re be re fe batho ba habo rona monyetla wa ho ba le seabo se seholo tswelopeleng.

eng: the fight against corruption must be intensified as well, especially given reports that some services are interrupted or stopped, so that certain people could provide those services at cost to the state.
sot: ntwa kgahlanong le bonyofonyofo e tlameha ho matlafatswa le yona, haholoholo ka lebaka la ditlaleho tsa hore ditshebeletso tse ding di a hakuretswa kapa di a kginwa, ho etsetsa hore batho ba itseng e be bona ba fanang ka ditshebeletso tseo ka ditjeo tse hodimo mmusong.

eng: these matters are being prioritised for the next administration.
sot: dintho tsena di beilwe ka sehloohong botsamaising bo tlang.

eng: honourable speaker and chairpersondemocratic south africa’s foreign policy was shaped many decades ago during the fierce international campaign to isolate the apartheid state.
sot: motsamaisi wa dipuisano le modulasetulo ba hlomphehangleano la tsa kantle la aforika borwa ya demokrasi le bopilwe dilemoshomeng tse ngata tse fetileng nakong ya letsholo le matla la ho kotela mmuso wa kgethollo matjhabeng.

eng: anc president oliver tambo played a key role in that regard, assisted by among others, the late johnny makatini, former head of international affairs.
sot: moporesidente wa anc ntate oliver tambo o bile le seabo sa bohlokwa ntlheng eo, mme e mong wa ba neng ba mo thusa ke mofu johnny makatini, hlooho ya mehleng ya merero ya matjhaba.

eng: his wife, mrs valerie makatini is one of our honoured guests this evening.
sot: mofumahadi wa hae, mme valerie makatini ke e mong wa baeti ba rona ba bohlokwa phirimaneng ena.

eng: africa has remained at the centre of our foreign policy.
sot: haesale aforika e ntse e le setsiketsing sa leano la rona la tsa kantle.

eng: we have worked hard to strengthen support for the african union, sadc and all continental bodies whose purpose is to achieve peace and security.
sot: re sebeditse ka thata ho matlafatsa tshehetso bakeng sa kopano ya aforika (au), sadc le mekgatlo yohle ya kontinente eo sepheo sa yona e leng ho fihlella kgotso le tshireletso.

eng: we have also prioritised the promotion of regional economic integration, infrastructure development, intra-african trade and sustainable development in the continent.
sot: re boetse ra bea ka sehloohong kgothaletso ya ho kopanngwa ha moruo wa lebatowa, kaho ya meralo ya motheo, kgwebisano ya aforika le ntshetsopele ya nako e telele kontinenteng.

eng: this year we also submitted our third country report to the au african peer review mechanism which was well received.
sot: monongwaha re boetse ra neana ka tlaleho ya boraro ya naha ya rona ho mokgwa wa tjhebobotjha ya semphato aforika wa au, mme e ile ya amohelwa ka kananelo.

eng: we continue to support peacemaking and conflict resolution.
sot: re tswela pele ho tshehetsa tharollo ya ho tlisa kgotso le ho fedisa dikgohlano.

eng: progress is being made in negotiations between sudan and south sudan on outstanding issues following the secession.
sot: kgatelopele e ntse e etsuwa dipakeng tsa sudan le sudan borwa dintlheng tse salletseng morao kamora qheo.

eng: following requests from sri lanka and south sudan for assistance in bringing about peace and reconciliation, mr cyril ramaphosa, has been appointed as south africa’s special envoy to the two countries.
sot: kamora dikopo tse entsweng ke sri lanka le sudan borwa tsa thuso ya ho tlisa kgotso le poelano, ntate cyril ramaphosa o thontswe ho ba moemedi ya kgethehileng wa aforika borwa dinaheng tseo tse pedi.

eng: his expertise in conflict resolution and negotiations as well as our country’s experience in this regard, will greatly assist the two countries to resolve their problems.
sot: boqhetseke ba hae tharollong ya dikgohlano le ditherisanong esita le malebela a naha ya rona ntlheng ena, di tla thusa haholo ho rarolleng mathata a dinaha tseo tse pedi.

eng: we will continue to strengthen relations with europe, north america, latin america, asia and countries in the south.
sot: re tla tswela pele ho matlafatsa dikamano le yuropa, amerika leboya, latin america, asia le dinaha tse ka borwa.

eng: participation in international multilateral forums such as the g20 have been beneficial for the country.
sot: ho ba le seabo diforamong tse kopantseng mekgatlo e mengata tse kang g20 ho tlisitse melemo naheng ya rona.

eng: and joining the brazil, russia, india and china (bric) group in december 2010 counts as among the key achievements of the fourth administration.
sot: ho mahatammoho le setlamo sa brazil, russia, india le china (bric) ka tshitwe ya 2010 ho balellwa ho tse ding tsa dikatleho tsa bohlokwa tsa botsamaisi ba bone.

eng: it was also a great honour to host the fifth brics summit on 27 march 2013 in durban, which saw the participation of african leaders to discuss developmental cooperation with brics.
sot: e bile tlotla e kgolo ho tshwara seboka sa bohlano sa brics ka la 27 hlakubele 2013 durban, moo baetapele ba aforika ba bileng le seabo sa ho tshohla tshebedisanommoho ya ntshetsopele le brics.

eng: we will continue to serve diligently in the united nations in promotion of strong international governance.
sot: re tla tswela pele ho sebetsa ka boikitlaetso mokgatlong wa matjhaba a kopaneng ho kgothaletsa puso e matla ya matjhaba.

eng: we will also continue promoting the reform of the un security council and global financial institutions.
sot: re tla nne re tswele pele ho kgothaletsa phetoho ya lekgotla la tshireletso la un le ditheo tsa ditjhelete lefatsheng.

eng: honourable membersas president of the cop17/cmp7 united nations climate change conference which was hosted in durban in 2011, south africa successfully placed the world on an unassailable course, through the adoption of the durban platform for enhanced action.
sot: ditho tse hlomphehangjwaloka moporesidente wa seboka sa cop17/cmp7 sa phetoho ya tlelaemete sa matjhaba a kopaneng se neng se tshwaretswe durban ka 2011, aforika borwa e atlehile ho bea lefatshe boemong bo sa qeaqeeeng, ka kananelo ya lepatlelo la durban bakeng sa kgato e ntlafaditsweng.

eng: compatriots,over the past 20 years we have hosted a number of international sporting and cultural visits, which has helped to boost social cohesion and unity.
sot: baheso,dilemong tse 20 tse fetileng re ile ra tshwara diketelo tse ngatanyana tsa dipapadi le tsa botjhaba boemong ba matjhaba, tse ileng tsa thusa ho matlafatsa momahano le kopano ya setjhaba.

eng: in the past five years, south africa hosted the highly successful 2010 fifa soccer world cup and other key soccer, rugby and cricket tournament, which left a tangible feeling of pride and unity among all south africans.
sot: dilemong tse hlano tse fetileng, aforika borwa e ile ya tshwara thonamente e atlehileng haholo ya mohope wa lefatshe wa bolo ya maoto wa fifa wa 2010 le dithonamente tse ding tsa bohlokwa tsa bolo ya maoto, rakabi le kherikete, tse siileng boikgantsho le kopano ho maaforika borwa ohle.

eng: as we celebrate 20 years of freedom, we will do so having done well in building a new heritage landscape for our country.
sot: jwaloka ha re keteka dilemo tse 20 tsa tokoloho, re tla etsa jwalo re sebeditse hantle ho aheng pono e ntjha ya letlotlo la botjhaba bakeng sa naha ya habo rona.

eng: a number of new museums and monuments were established, including the statue of former president mandela which has become a landmark in the union buildings.
sot: dimusiamo le difika tse ngatanyana di ile tsa thewa, ho akga le seemahale se union buildings sa moporesidente wa mehleng ntate mandela se fetohileng thatohatsi .

eng: more than 2000 geographical names have been changed in order to correct the ill-naming of places, as well as to give communities the right to determine the names of their areas.
sot: mabitso a dibaka a fetang 2 000 a ile a fetolwa ka sepheo sa ho lokisa theo e mpe ya mabitso a dibaka, esita le ho fa setjhaba tokelo ya ho ikgethela mabitso a dibaka tsa sona.

eng: honourable membersallow me to acknowledge some of our compatriots who are making their mark in the world.
sot: ditho tse hlomphehangntumelleng ho ananela boteng ba ba bang ba batho baheso ba ipabolang lefatsheng.

eng: we congratulate ladysmith black mambazo on winning their fourth grammy award last month.
sot: re thoholetsa ladysmith black mambazo ka ho hapa kgau ya bona ya bone ya grammy kgweding e fetileng.

eng: we welcome the group leader, mr joseph shabalala, one of our guests this evening.
sot: re amohela moetapele wa sehlopha, ntate joseph shabalala, e mong wa baeti ba rona ba bohlokwa phirimaneng ena.

eng: we also acknowledge ms yvonne chaka chaka who is one of our guests this evening.
sot: re boetse re ananela boteng ba mme yvonne chaka chaka, eo e leng e mong wa baeti ba rona ba bohlokwa phirimaneng ena.

eng: she is doing a lot of good work as the united nations children’s fund goodwill ambassador for malaria in africa and also the united nations millennium development goals special envoy for africa.
sot: o etsa mosebetsi o mongata o motle e le leqosa la kgauhelo la letlole la bana la matjhaba a kopaneng hape e le moemedi ya kgethehileng wa aforika ho maikemisetso a matjhaba a kopaneng a ntshetsopele ya mileniamo.

eng: ms chaka chaka was also honoured with the crystal award by the world economic forum in davos for her humanitarian work.
sot: mme chaka chaka o ile a boela a tlotlwa ka kgau ya lehakwe ke foramo ya moruo wa lefatshe davos bakeng sa mosebetsi wa hae wa thekolohelo.

eng: we also recognise, in her absence, our oscar award-winning hollywood star, ms charlize theron.
sot: re boela re ananela mme charlize theron, bosiyong ba hae, kgalala ya rona ya hollywood e hapileng kgau ya oscar.

eng: ms theron is also the un messenger for peace.
sot: mme theron ke morumuwa wa kgotso wa un.

eng: she also champions the fight against aids especially amongst the youth and young women.
sot: o boetse o etelletse pele twantsho ya aids haholoholo hara batjha le dikgarebe.

eng: she was also honoured by the world economic forum with a crystal award.
sot: le yena o ile a tlotlwa ke foramo ya moruo wa lefatshe ka kgau ya lehakwe.

eng: compatriotsyou would have noticed that in this sona we have given a report of the past five yearsin particular and over the past 20 years in general.
sot: bahesole lokela hore le hlokometse hore ho sona ena re fane ka tlaleho ya dilemo tse hlano tse fetileng ka botebonyana esita le dilemo tse 20 tse fetileng ka kakaretso.

eng: this is not an occasion to present the programme of action for this financial year.
sot: ona ha se moketjana wa ho teka lenaneo la tshebetso la selemo sena sa ditjhelete.

eng: that programme will be presented by the new government after the elections.
sot: lenaneo leo le tla tekwa ke mmuso o motjha kamora dikgetho.

eng: to prepare for that first state of the nation address by the incoming administration later in the year, we have over the past year, been working on a medium term strategic framework.
sot: ho lokisetsa sona eo ya pele ya botsamaisi bo tla kena, nakong ya selemo e fetileng, re ne re sebetsana le moralo wa lewa la nako e bohareng.

eng: the framework has been designed as the first five year building block of the national development plan, from 2014 to 2019. it also incorporates key targets of the industrial policy action plan, the new growth path and infrastructure plan.
sot: moralo oo o radilwe e le motheo wa dilemo tse hlano tsa pele tsa ndp, ho tloha ka 2014 ho ya ho 2019. di boela di kenyeletsa dipehelo tsa bohlokwa tsa morero wa tshebetso wa leano la diindasteri, tsela ya kgolo e ntjha le morero wa meralo ya motheo.

eng: the intention is to table the draft framework to the first cabinet lekgotla after the elections.
